abstract: Records provided by New York attorney general's office show that the state paid out at least $5 million to settle sexual harassment cases from 2008 to 2010; scrutiny of the state's handling of sexual harassment allegations has increased since the Assembly acknowledged using more than $100,000 in public money to settle accusations against Brooklyn Democratic Assemblyman Vito J Lopez.
lead_paragraph: None of the cases, from 2008 to 2010, included confidentiality provisions, like the language included in the settlement involving Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez.
